name: NSTextInputClient
desc: A set of methods that text views must implement to interact properly with the text input management system.

items.name: func hasMarkedText() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the receiver has marked text.

items.name: func markedRange() -> NSRange
items.desc: Returns the range of the marked text.

items.name: func selectedRange() -> NSRange
items.desc: Returns the range of selected text.

items.name: func setMarkedText(Any, selectedRange: NSRange, replacementRange: NSRange)
items.desc: Replaces a specified range in the receiverâ€™s text storage with the given string and sets the selection.

items.name: func validAttributesForMarkedText() -> [NSAttributedString.Key]
items.desc: Returns an array of attribute names recognized by the receiver.

items.name: func attributedSubstring(forProposedRange: NSRange, actualRange: NSRangePointer?) -> NSAttributedString?
items.desc: Returns an attributed string derived from the given range in the receiver's text storage.

items.name: func insertText(Any, replacementRange: NSRange)
items.desc: Inserts the given string into the receiver, replacing the specified content.

items.name: func characterIndex(for: NSPoint) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the index of the character whose bounding rectangle includes the given point.

items.name: func firstRect(forCharacterRange: NSRange, actualRange: NSRangePointer?) -> NSRect
items.desc: Returns the first logical boundary rectangle for characters in the given range.

items.name: func doCommand(by: Selector)
items.desc: Invokes the action specified by the given selector.

items.name: func attributedString() -> NSAttributedString
items.desc: Returns an attributed string representing the receiver's text storage.

items.name: func fractionOfDistanceThroughGlyph(for: NSPoint) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Returns the fraction of the distance from the left side of the character to the right side that a given point lies.

items.name: func baselineDeltaForCharacter(at: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Returns the baseline position of a given character relative to the origin of rectangle returned by firstRect(forCharacterRange:actualRange:).

items.name: func windowLevel() -> Int
items.desc: Returns the window level of the receiver.

items.name: func drawsVerticallyForCharacter(at: Int) -> Bool
items.desc: Informs the text input management system whether the protocol-conforming client renders the character at the given index vertically.
